page.title: 13Verwood's Printed Media.
page.content: The 'Viewpoint Magazine' was started by the Parish Council to help everyone know what was going on in the parish of Verwood. It has letters from residents, advertisements, a village diary, stories and news from the village organisations and the Parish Council. There is an editor, a paster and there are other committee members. It is published once a month and costs 30p. The committee organise a village concert once a year, when people from the village take part. The profits help towards the cost of the magazine. The local churches publish their own magazines about all their activities. A Verwood and Three Legged Cross Guide is published annually. Some local history has been recorded in three booklets: Verwood and District Potteries - A Brief History of Verwood - Verwood Church School 1847 to 1985.
